artists.name: Sophia Gao
artists.biography:
Sophia Gao is a contemporary artist whose work explores the intersection of traditional Chinese aesthetics and modern urban experiences. Gao's practice spans painting, mixed media, and installation art.

Her distinctive visual language combines delicate brushwork with bold compositional structures, creating works that bridge Eastern and Western artistic traditions. Through her art, Gao investigates themes of cultural identity, memory, and transformation in an increasingly globalized world.

Gao has exhibited internationally and her works are held in private collections across North America and Asia. She currently lives and works in Vancouver, Canada.

artists.name: Susan G. Scott
artists.thumbnailImage: Susan G. Scott/Spring Water, 2023, 40 x 60 inches , 101.6 x 152.4 cm, oil on canvas.jpg
artists.biography:
Susan G. Scott is a multidisciplinary artist whose practice encompasses sculpture, installation, and performance art. Scott has spent over three decades developing a unique artistic voice that challenges conventional notions of space, materiality, and viewer engagement.

Her work is characterized by an exploration of organic forms and natural materials, often creating immersive environments that invite contemplation and sensory experience. Scott's sculptures balance delicacy and strength, ephemeral and permanent, creating dialogues between opposing forces.

Scott has received numerous awards and grants, and her work has been exhibited in major galleries and museums internationally. She is based in Toronto, Canada.

artists.name: Christine Reimer
artists.thumbnailImage: Christine Reimer/Celestial Mountains I 40″ x 40″  Acrylic on canvas.jpg
artists.biography:
Christine Reimer is a conceptual artist whose interdisciplinary practice investigates the relationship between language, image, and meaning. Reimer works across photography, text-based art, installation, and video.

Her work often employs systems of classification and archival methods to examine how we construct narratives and preserve memory. Through meticulous research and careful formal considerations, Reimer creates works that are both intellectually rigorous and visually compelling.

Reimer has exhibited nationally and internationally, with works in numerous public and private collections. She is a Professor of Art at a leading Canadian university and maintains an active studio practice in Calgary.
